pages.text: Greetings, and welcome to the world of engineering. This book shall serve as your guide for setting up a factory all your own. With the skills you learn in this book, you can build a factory to mass-produce nearly everything you'd ever need.

Any successful engineer is familiar with both $(italic)Kinetic$() (AKA $(italic)mechanical$()) and $(italic)Electrical$() (AKA $(italic)Flux$()) energy. These two types of energy each have their own machines they can power. The difference is kinetic energy $(bold)can't be stored$().$(br2)Along with energy, you will learn how to transport and store items and fluids.

pages.title: Where do I start?
pages.text: Assuming your basic survival needs are met, of course, the best place to start would be with $(l:patchouli:essentials/coke_oven)Coke Oven$(). With it, you can make creosote oil and a better fuel.
You will need this to assemble multiblocks, which includes the Coke Oven mentioned previously. For more information, see the $(hammer) entry.
